column4: hiya! so I just ran a set of updates and rebooted.. somewhere along the line, grub's configuration was goofed up such that it isn't able to find *any* of the kernels in /boot
where do I begin trying to fix this?
I'm wondering if the uuid is off.. but the ubuntu livecd doesn't have the vol_id program
boot up a liveCD (this is not wubi?)
I'm in the ubuntu live cd
wubi installs ubuntu "inside" windows, that's noth the case here right?
ok, good :) Then it should be a simple matter of reinstalling grub, When you boot does the grub menu show up?
But it doesn't start when you chose a menu alternative?
are you suggesting I just reinstall grub?
So grub gives that error message "unable to open file" or something like that?
Also are you using grub2 (fresh install of karmic) or grub-legacy (basically any other case)
there is no grub-update on the livecd
I'm going to reboot to test fixing the UUID, I'm in IRC via screen on another server, so I won't go anywhere but will be back in a few
